etymology.description: semantic: 艹(艹) (cǎo, "grass") + phonetic: 樂(樂) (lè, "music") = plant-based remedy -> medicine
etymology.interpretation: 藥(藥) (yào, "medicine") combines the semantic 艹(艹) (cǎo, "grass"), reflecting the use of plants in remedies, with the phonetic 樂(樂) (lè, "music"), indicating the sound element of the original character. This construction signifies plant-derived compounds for healing.
etymology.simplification: 藥(藥) was first simplified by the Republic of China as 葯(葯) with intended phonetic alignment, and later as 药(藥) in the People's Republic of China by replacing 樂(樂) with 乐(乐) (lè, "joy"), further simplified to 药(藥) using 约(约) (yuē, "agreement") for phonetic simplicity.

examples.chinese: 医生给我开药(醫生給我開藥)。
病人生病了(病人生病了)，需要药治疗(需要藥治療)。
examples.pinyin: Bìngrén shēngbìng le， xūyào yào zhìliáo。
examples.english: The patient fell ill and needs medicine for treatment.

examples.chinese: 古人常用药(古人常用藥)，以解百病(以解百病)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔrén cháng yòng yào， yǐ jiě bǎi bìng。
examples.english: Ancient people commonly used medicine to cure all ailments.
